title: A D&D-based guide to Contribution and Inclusion in the Python Community
description:
The Python community needs many different types of contributions to
thrive. If you ever thought, "I'm not a great programmer, so I can't
contribute to the Python community. :-(", you're WRONG!

First, using classes and roles from Dungeons & Dragons (D&D) as a lens,
we'll look at multiple contributing roles in the Python community, and
how you can find one that fits you. Not familiar with D&D? I'll provide
a brief, relevant primer.

Next, we'll continue the discussion to see how Inclusiveness helps us
get those different contributors into the Python community. To use D&D
language, a party of only one class won't go far. We'll also look at how
Inclusiveness is NOT the same thing as Diversity or Political
Correctness.
